prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2143, 0.0] Proceed by generating a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch consists of the following: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.3214] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.3214] to [0.5357, 0.5357] - Line 4: [0.5357, 0.5357] to [0.2143, 0.5357] - Line 5: [0.2143, 0.5357] to [0.2143, 0.3214] - Line 6: [0.2143, 0.3214] to [0.0, 0.3214] - Line 7: [0.0, 0.3214] to [0.0, 0.0] Next, scale the 2D sketch by 75% (0.75) in all directions. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. Once transformed, extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2143 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 This step creates an intermediate Cad part with the following dimensions: - Length (X): 0.75 m - Width (Y): 0.2143 m - Height (Z): 0.2143 m The first part is complete, a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, which will serve as the base part for following parts.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.2143,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.3214]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.3214],"End Point":[0.5357,0.5357]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5357,0.5357],"End Point":[0.2143,0.5357]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2143,0.5357],"End Point":[0.2143,0.3214]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.2143,0.3214],"End Point":[0.0,0.3214]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3214],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2143,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape: Rectangular metal plate with two circular holes on opposite sides Dimensions: * Height: 0.3696 meters * Width: 0.0495 meters * Length: 0.3696 meters 2D Sketch Instructions 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) degrees * Translation Vector: (0.7005, 0, 0) meters 2. Draw a rectangle in the XY plane with the following dimensions: * Height: 0.2062 meters * Width: 0.3696 meters 3. Draw two circles in the XY plane with the following properties: * Loop 2: Center (0.074, 0.1199) meters, Radius: 0.0507 meters * Loop 3: Center (0.2889, 0.1031) meters, Radius: 0.0479 meters Extrusion Instructions 1. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.3696. 2. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.0495 meters, creating a solid body. 3. Create a new solid body. Part 2 Instructions Shape: Two cylindrical rods of equal length, parallel to each other, with a slight taper towards the ends Dimensions: * Height: 0.75 meters * Width: 0.2933 meters * Length: 0.2933 meters 2D Sketch Instructions 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (-90, 0, -90) degrees * Translation Vector: (0.75, 0.0279, 0.0709) meters 2. Draw two circles in the XY plane with the following properties: * Face 1, Loop 1: Center (0.0462, 0.049) meters, Radius: 0.0462 meters * Face 2, Loop 1: Center (0.2611, 0.0322) meters, Radius: 0.0322 meters Extrusion Instructions 1. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.2933. 2. Extrude the 2D sketch in the positive Z direction with a depth of 0.75 meters, creating a solid body. 3. Create a new solid body. Final Assembly 1. Align part 1 and part 2 so that the XY planes are coincident and the Z-axes are parallel. 2. Place part 1 so that the bottom of the rectangle (Z = 0) is flush with the XY plane of part 2. 3. Combine part 1 and part 2 using a "JoinFeatureOperation". The final assembly should display as a rectangular object with two cylindrical protrusions on either side, connected by a flat surface.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.7005,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.3696,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3696,0.0],"End Point":[0.3696,0.2062]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3696,0.2062],"End Point":[0.0,0.2062]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2062],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.074,0.1199],"Radius":0.0507}},"loop_3":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2889,0.1031],"Radius":0.0479}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0495,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.3696,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.75,0.0279,0.0709]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.0462,0.049],"Radius":0.0462}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2611,0.0322],"Radius":0.0322}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.75,"sketch_scale":0.2933,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom (Part 1). Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, draw a loop on face 1. The loop consists of 6 lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.375] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.375, 0.375] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.375, 0.75] 5. Line 5: Start Point [0.375, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] 6. Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.375 units in the normal direction and scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 (Part 1). Next, create a second coordinate system for Part 2. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.375, 0.0, 0.375]. For Part 2, create a new sketch on face 1. Draw a loop with the following lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch for Part 2 by a depth of 0.375 units in the normal direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.375 (Part 2). Join Part 2 with the existing model (Part 1) to complete the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The final shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 1.125 - Width: 1.125 - Height: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>**Cylindrical Container with a Handle** The CAD model consists of three parts: the cylindrical container, the handle, and the flat top and bottom. **Part 1: Cylindrical Container** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Create the sketch for the cylindrical container as follows: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: [0.2245, 0.2245] - Radius: 0.2245 Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter: 0.449. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.449 - operation: "NewBodyFeatureOperation" **Part 2: Handle** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0424, 0.75, 0.0424] Create the sketch for the handle as follows: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: [0.1822, 0.1822] - Radius: 0.1822 Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter: 0.3643. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.732 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.3643 - operation: "CutFeatureOperation" **Part 3: Flat Top and Bottom** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.4419, 0.0945, 0.2245] Create the sketch for the flat top and bottom as follows: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Arc 1: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.6293] - Mid Point: [0.2634, 0.3153] - End Point: [0.0016, 0.0] - Line 1: - Start Point: [0.0016, 0.0] - End Point: [0.0052, 0.0545] - Arc 2: - Start Point: [0.0052, 0.0545] - Mid Point: [0.1954, 0.3116] - End Point: [0.0052, 0.5686] - Line 2: - Start Point: [0.0052, 0.5686] - End Point: [0.0, 0.6293] Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter: 0.6293. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0585 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.6293 - operation: "JoinFeatureOperation"</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base of the final shape The base is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.5357, 0.0) 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. **Create the first face** of the sketch: - Draw line 1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Draw line 2 from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.4929, 0.3214) - Draw line 3 from (0.4929, 0.3214) to (0.3214, 0.5357) - Draw line 4 from (0.3214, 0.5357) to (0.0, 0.5357) - Close the loop by connecting line 5 from (0.0, 0.5357) to (0.0, 0.0) 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** with 0.5357 units of extrusion towards the normal and 0 units opposite the normal. Part 2 Instructions Create the top and bottom tapered sections The top and bottom sections are three-dimensional, rectangular prisms with a tapered top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.4534, 0.5357, 0.012) 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. **Create the first face** of the sketch: - Draw line 1 from (0.0, 0.3537) to (0.2936, 0.0) - Draw line 2 from (0.2936, 0.0) to (0.2936, 0.3537) - Draw line 3 from (0.2936, 0.3537) to (0.0, 0.3537) 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.3537. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** with 0.2143 units of extrusion towards the normal and 0 units opposite the normal. Final shape The final shape is the combination of the base and the top/bottom tapered sections.</description>
